description: Buy and hold a security for the long term, regardless of market fluctuations.
rationale: Historically, the stock market has trended upward over time, providing long-term investors with capital appreciation and dividend income.
investing_conditions: Buy a security and hold it for an extended period, typically years or decades.
expected_outcome: Benefit from long-term market growth and compounding returns.

description: Utilize short-term and long-term moving averages to identify buy and sell signals.
rationale: When a short-term moving average crosses above a long-term moving average, it signals a potential upward trend (bullish). Conversely, a cross below indicates a potential downward trend (bearish).
investing_conditions: Buy when the short-term average crosses above the long-term average; sell when it crosses below.
expected_outcome: Capture trends early and maximize returns during upward movements while limiting losses during downturns.

description: Use the RSI to identify overbought and oversold conditions for potential reversals.
rationale: An RSI above 70 indicates overbought conditions, while below 30 indicates oversold conditions, suggesting potential reversals.
investing_conditions: Buy when RSI is below 30; sell when RSI is above 70.
expected_outcome: Enter positions at favorable prices, benefiting from market corrections.

description: Utilize MACD to identify divergence between price and momentum.
rationale: Divergence indicates potential reversals; if prices are making new highs while MACD is making lower highs, it may indicate weakness.
investing_conditions: Buy when MACD shows bullish divergence; sell on bearish divergence.
expected_outcome: Identify reversal points to enter or exit trades effectively.

description: Use Bollinger Bands to identify price volatility and potential breakouts.
rationale: When the price breaks above the upper band, it may indicate a bullish breakout; below the lower band may indicate a bearish breakout.
investing_conditions: Buy when the price closes above the upper band; sell when it closes below the lower band.
expected_outcome: Capitalize on strong price movements post-breakout.

description: Use the Stochastic Oscillator to identify overbought and oversold conditions in the market.
rationale: Values above 80 indicate overbought conditions; below 20 indicate oversold conditions, which can suggest potential reversals.
investing_conditions: Buy when the Stochastic crosses above 20; sell when it crosses below 80.
expected_outcome: Take advantage of price reversals based on overbought/oversold conditions.

description: Use the Average Directional Movement Index (ADX) to determine trend strength.
rationale: An ADX value above 25 indicates a strong trend, while below 20 indicates a weak trend.
investing_conditions: Buy when ADX is above 25 and +DI is above -DI; sell when ADX is above 25 and -DI is above +DI.
expected_outcome: Engage in trades that align with strong trends to maximize profits.

description: Use volume indicators to confirm price movements.
rationale: High volume during a price increase indicates strength in the movement; low volume may indicate weakness.
investing_conditions: Buy when price rises with increased volume; sell when price falls with increased volume.
expected_outcome: Enhance trade accuracy by confirming price movements with volume.

description: Use the Commodity Channel Index (CCI) to identify overbought and oversold levels.
rationale: A CCI above 100 indicates overbought conditions, while below -100 indicates oversold conditions.
investing_conditions: Buy when CCI crosses above -100; sell when it crosses below 100.
expected_outcome: Identify potential reversal points based on overbought/oversold conditions.

description: Use Keltner Channels to identify price breakouts and reversals.
rationale: Price movements outside the channels can indicate potential breakouts or reversals.
investing_conditions: Buy when price closes above the Keltner Channel; sell when it closes below.
expected_outcome: Capitalize on strong price movements following breakouts.

description: Use MFI to measure the flow of money into and out of a security.
rationale: MFI above 80 indicates overbought; below 20 indicates oversold conditions, suggesting potential reversals.
investing_conditions: Buy when MFI crosses below 20; sell when MFI crosses above 80.
expected_outcome: Enter trades based on potential market corrections.

description: Use the Trix indicator to identify trends and potential reversals.
rationale: A positive Trix indicates an upward trend; a negative Trix indicates a downward trend.
investing_conditions: Buy when Trix crosses above zero; sell when it crosses below.
expected_outcome: Capture trends early and secure profits.

description: Combine price movement and volume to assess the strength of a price trend.
rationale: A rising Force Index indicates increasing buying pressure, while a declining index indicates selling pressure.
investing_conditions: Buy when Force Index is above zero and rising; sell when it falls below zero.
expected_outcome: Identify strong buying/selling opportunities based on pressure.

description: Use the Vortex Indicator to identify potential trend reversals.
rationale: When the +VI crosses above -VI, it indicates an upward trend; vice versa for a downward trend.
investing_conditions: Buy when +VI crosses above -VI; sell when -VI crosses above +VI.
expected_outcome: Engage in trades aligned with emerging trends.

description: Use the Ichimoku Cloud to identify support, resistance, and trend direction.
rationale: Price above the cloud indicates bullish conditions, while below indicates bearish conditions.
investing_conditions: Buy when price is above the cloud; sell when it is below.
expected_outcome: Trade with significant support/resistance levels in mind.

description: Use the Ultimate Oscillator to identify potential price reversals based on momentum.
rationale: Values above 70 indicate overbought conditions; below 30 indicate oversold conditions.
investing_conditions: Buy when the Ultimate Oscillator is below 30; sell when it is above 70.
expected_outcome: Enter trades at optimal points based on momentum shifts.

description: Use the NVI to identify trends based on volume changes.
rationale: Rising NVI indicates bullish trends, while falling NVI may indicate bearish trends.
investing_conditions: Buy when NVI is rising; sell when NVI is falling.
expected_outcome: Align trades with underlying volume trends.

description: Analyze daily returns to gauge stock momentum.
rationale: Consistent positive daily returns can indicate strong upward momentum.
investing_conditions: Buy after three consecutive positive daily returns; sell after three consecutive negative returns.

description: Evaluate cumulative returns to assess long-term performance.
rationale: Strong cumulative returns may indicate a solid investment opportunity.
investing_conditions: Buy when cumulative returns are positive; sell when they turn negative.
expected_outcome: Invest in stocks with strong long-term performance.
